comments: Hield (IND) and Herro (MIA) engage and disengage with one another off-ball.
Mathurin (IND) and Strus (MIA) engage and disengage with one another off-ball.
Mathurin (IND) does not maintain verticality and turns his body into Herro (MIA), affecting his driving shot attempt.
Turner (IND) brings his forearm toward Strus' (MIA) front and marginal contact occurs as Strus attempts the put-back.
Turner (IND) and Strus (MIA) each make clean contact with the ball as simultaneous incidental contact occurs during rebounding.

call_type: Turnover: Lost Ball Out of Bounds
comments: Strus' (MIA) fingertips touch the ball last before it goes out of bounds.
Vincent (MIA) maintains a collapsed right forearm on Haliburton's (IND) front and marginal contact occurs during Haliburton's driving shot attempt.
Turner (IND) initiates contact with Herro's (MIA) right elbow during his upward shooting motion.
Turner (IND) establishes a wide screening position outside of VIncent's (MIA) field of vision and does not give Vincent a step of distance to avoid the contact, which occurs to Vincent's leg.
Turner (IND) establishes himself in Vincent's (MIA) path and does not deliver illegal contact.
Vincent (MIA) initiates contact across Haliburton's (IND) left arm during his upward shooting motion.
Adebayo (MIA) keeps his hand on the side of the ball in between dribbles.
Turner (IND) and Adebayo (MIA) come together at the same spot during the drive and each absorb the marginal contact that occurs.
Lowry (MIA) brushes Haliburton's (IND) right arm and marginal contact occurs after Haliburton already mishandles the ball, which he quickly gains full control of thereafter.
Adebayo (MIA) engages and disengages with Turner (IND) as Turner moves to set the pick.

Lowry (MIA) is jumping to the side of Haliburton (IND) and would avoid Haliburton if he did not extend his left leg outside the frame of his body to create the marginal foot contact after the release.
Turner (IND) and Strus (MIA) engage and disengage with one another after the release of the jump shot attempt.

Herro (MIA) moves toward Hield (IND) with his hands brought forward slightly and marginal contact occurs with Hield's side as he retrieves the rebounding. Herro then brushes Hield's left arm as he returns to the floor and further marginal contact occurs.
After absorbing the initial contact that occurs, Vincent (MIA) makes clean contact with the ball and ties Hield (IND) up. A jump ball is correctly assessed.
Strus (MIA) maintains a rested hand on Haliburton's (IND) right arm and marginal contact occurs as the ball falls away from Haliburton following the jump ball.
Herro (MIA) and Nembhard (IND) engage and disengage with one another during the inbound.
Nembhard (IND) stops his forward momentum and marginal contact occurs with Lowry's (MIA) side as he returns to the floor after retrieving the ball.

Hield (IND) maintains a rested hand on Strus' (MIA) side and marginal contact occurs during Strus' drive to the lane and shot attempt. Turner (IND) then establishes verticality and absorbs the body contact that occurs with Strus after the release.
Nembhard (IND) and Herro (MIA) engage and disengage with one another during the inbound.

After communicating with the Replay Center, the on-court ruling of goaltending by Turner (IND) was changed to an inadvertent whistle. Miami was deemed to have imminent possession of the ball and was subsequently awarded possession following the review.
Nembhard (IND) commits a take foul on Herro (MIA). The contact occurs prior to the start of Herro's upward shooting motion.
Vincent (MIA) and Haliburton (IND) engage and disengage with one another during the inbound.
Martin (MIA) engages and disengages with Hield (IND) during the inbound.
Strus (MIA) commits a take foul on Mathurin (IND).
Nembhard (IND) briefly has his arm around Herro's (MIA) midsection and quickly slides it off during the inbound.
Nembhard (IND) legally contests Herro's (MIA) jump shot attempt.
Strus (MIA) and Hield (IND) jump toward one another as they pursue the rebound and incidental body contact occurs.
